title: Display previews for image URLs
body: # Feature Issue Display image URLs differently than common unfurleable URLs like https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Limnic_eruption. ### User Story ``` As a user, I want to send messages with one or more HTTP image URLs, So that message receivers can see image previews without having to open the original URLs and expose themselves to centralized servers. ``` ### Scope When user sends a message with an image URL for the first time, the designs show we should show a confirmation bottom sheet to enable or disable link previews. It's okay to work on this in a separate issue since it may involve changes in status-go. ### Notes It is common to have image URLs without an extension. As of today (2023-08-21), status-go doesn't support fetching thumbnails for URLs _without_ extensions because its detection mechanism is not based on the response header `Content-Type`. #### Confirmation dialog to open image When the user presses on an image URL, a confirmation dialog should be displayed, so the user can choose between a dApp or a browser, but it can be annoying for the user to always perform this step. Consider talking to a designer about this problem. #### Composer preview icon Unfurled image URLs should have their image thumbnails in place of the favicons as we would usually display for non-image URLs. ### Resources Designs: https://www.figma.com/file/wA8Epdki2OWa8Vr067PCNQ/Composer-for-Mobile?type=design&node-id=9638-32638&mode=design&t=iMFvsLtbGRnWWnYd-0
